intro: Solanum manabiense, commonly known as the Manabí nightshade, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of Ecuador. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and potatoes. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are ovate with a hairy texture, and it produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are usually white or pale green. The fruit is a berry that turns from green to red when mature, containing numerous seeds.
